headline: Deloitte funded group that wants to keep homeless on subways
author: Melissa Klein
sentences: The corporate employer of tragic subway shoving victim Michelle Go, who was allegedly killed by an unhinged vagrant, helped fund a progressive non-profit that sued to keep the homeless from being ousted from the NYC transit system.

Doing so puts downward pressure on the taxes it pays to the city, so donating to a Marxist front group is good for the all-important bottom line, but less so for the health of their employees (to the extent that they care).
He told reporters he did it “because of God.” Deloitte Financial Advisory Services donated between $25,000 and $50,000 in 2021 to the Urban Justice Center, according to the group’s annual report.
Go, 40, a senior manager at consulting conglomerate Deloitte, was killed Jan. 15 when Simon Martial, 61, allegedly pushed her in front of an oncoming train at the Times Square station.

Comments:
Deloitte must profit in some way by having insane people use the subways as a homeless shelter.
